data.sampled:
The Constitution (Amendment) Act of India is amended by the 42nd Amendment Act in 1976 to include some basic principles as Directive Principles for the state's policies and programs. Among these principles are:

(a) Equal pay for equal work for both men and women

This directive principle aims at ensuring that men and women are paid equally for performing similar jobs or tasks. It seeks to eliminate gender disparities in wages and promotes gender equality in the workplace. This is an important step towards achieving economic justice and eliminating discrimination against women.

(b) Participation of workers in management

This directive principle encourages participation of workers in decision making processes related to their employment and working conditions. It recognizes the importance of worker's involvement in managing organizations and promoting productivity through collective bargaining and collaboration between labor and management.

(c) Right to education, social security and public assistance

This directive principle emphasizes the right of all citizens to access quality education and social security benefits. Additionally, it also highlights the need for providing public assistance to those who require it due to old age, disablement or other reasons beyond their control.

(d) Living wage and humane conditions of work

This directive principle emphasizes the need for ensuring that workers receive fair compensation for their labor, which should be sufficient to provide them with decent living standards. In addition, it calls upon the government to promote safe and healthy working conditions for all employees.

data.sampled:
Based on the context provided regarding bioremediation as a solution to environmental pollution, which of the following benefits can be attributed to it? Choose only one option.

Answers are given below the questions.

(a) Only this technique involves nature's process of biodegradation for removing harmful elements from the environment.
(b) This technology uses heavy metals such as cadmium and lead in any kind of waste remover, making bioremediation a complete and easy way to clean up pollutants using microorganisms.
(c) Bioremediation requires specifically designed microorganisms to treat any type of polluter, so genetic engineering (genetic engineering) is used to create them.

(c) There is no evidence that people of Sindhu Ghati knew how to make wheels for carts whereas this technology was known by Rigvedic Aryans.

prompt.content:
2. ऋग्वेद-कालीन आर्यों और सिन्धु घाटी के लोगों की संस्कृति के बीच अंतर के संबंध में, निम्नलिखित कथनों में से कौन-सा/से सही है/हैं?
1- ऋग्वेद-कालीन आर्य कवच और शिरस्त्रण (हेलमेट) का उपयोग करते थे जबकि सिन्धु घाटी सभ्यता के लोगों में इनके उपयोग का कोई साध्य नहीं मिलता।
2- ऋग्वेद-कालीन आर्यों को स्वर्ण, चाँदी और ताम्र का ज्ञान था जबकि सिन्धु घाटी के लोगों को कवल ताम्र और लोह का ज्ञान था।
3- ऋग्वेद-कालीन आर्यों ने घोड़े को पालतू बना लिया था जबकि इस बात का कोई साक्ष्य नहीं है कि सिन्धु घाअी के लोग इस पशु को जानते थे।

नीचे दिए गए कूट का प्रयोग कर सही उत्तर चुनिएः

(a) केवल 1
(b) केवल 2 और 3
(c) केवल 1 और 3
(d) 1, 2 और 3

, choose correct answer:
